edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Person
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Player
extends Person
    The Player object represents the user who is playing the game. He or she will be holding a blaster of type Gun, which they can shoot at a Jedi. The player will have a set number of lives, and when that number reaches 0, the game will end. During their turn, the player has the option to either move one space, (up, down, left, or right), look ahead 2 spaces, or shoot their blaster, hopefully hitting a Jedi in the process. The player may also pick up a power-up item that is located on one of the regular spaces.
    Author:
    Team Jedi
    See Also:

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      The player constructor will call the constructor of the super class, and will set the player's location, construct the player's gun, their beginning amount of lives, and beginning invincibilityCounter.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        This is the default serial ID of the Player class
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • blaster

        private Gun blaster
        This is the gun that the player will use to try to stop the Jedi from attacking. The blaster will start with only one shot, so the player must use the shot wisely.

      • lives

        private int lives
        This determines how many lives the player has left. It will be from 0 <= x <= 4. When it reaches 0, the game will end.

      • invincibilityCounter

        private int invincibilityCounter
        This will keep track of how many turns the player is invincible to Jedi attacks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        The player constructor will call the constructor of the super class, and will set the player's location, construct the player's gun, their beginning amount of lives, and beginning invincibilityCounter.

    • Method Detail

      • die

        public void die(Map m,
       boolean b)
         throws GameOverException
        When the die method is called, the player's lives will be reduced by 1, and their location will be reset to the beginning location. Also, if lives = 0, then it will call an exception that will end the game.
        Overrides:
        die in class Person
        Parameters:
        m - The map needed so that we can get the areas.
        b - The isDebug boolean
        Throws:
        GameOverException

      • move

        public void move(int d,
        Map m)
        This method will move the player's location to the next spot in one place. the integer d will determine the direction of the movement.
        Parameters:
        d - determines which way the player moves (1 for up, 2 for right, 3 for down, and 4 for left).

      • shoot

        public int shoot(int d,
        Map m,
        boolean b)
        The shoot method will check to see if there are any Jedi in the path of direction d, and then it will call the Gun.shoot() method. If there are Jedi in the path, it will call the Person.die() method of the jedi in the way. If there is not enough bullets, it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which the player shoots his or her blaster.

      • look

        public void look(int d,
        Map m,
        Jedi[] j,
        AddAmmoPowerUp a,
        InvincibilityPowerUp in,
        RadarPowerUp r)
        The look method will look two spaces ahead of the player in the direction given. It will return the amount of Jedi that are in those two spaces. It will return 0 if there are no Jedi in those spaces.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which the player looks

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
        This method is used to check how many lives the player has left.
        Returns:
        The variable lives.

      • getInvincibilityCounter

        public int getInvincibilityCounter()
        This returns the amount of turns the player has left while invincible, while decreasing that amount by 1.
        Returns:
        The variable invincibilityCounter--

      • getInvincibilityCounter

        public int getInvincibilityCounter(boolean noChange)
        Returns the invincibilityCounter, so that we can use it in the main code.
        Parameters:
        noChange - It will always pass true, to differentiate it from the other method.
        Returns:
        invincibilityCounter

      • setInvincibilityCounter

        public void setInvincibilityCounter(int a)
        This is called from the InvincibilityPowerUp object to add a amount of turns to the players invincibilityCounter.
        Parameters:
        a - The amount of turns the player can be invincible.

        public Gun getGun()
        Returns the Gun object in Player
        Returns:
